text: Open Voice OS (OVOS) Core is responsible for handling skills, intents, and dialog management. It connects to the OVOS messagebus for communication between components.
OVOS Audio handles microphone input and speaker output. It connects to STT (speech-to-text) and TTS (text-to-speech) services such as Whisper or Piper, often via Wyoming-based servers.
HiveMind allows lightweight satellite devices to connect to a central brain over the network. Satellites send audio or intents to the main server running OVOS and the LLM stack.
When OVOS is not responding to voice, check that the messagebus is running and that OVOS Core, OVOS Audio, and any STT/TTS services can connect to it.
If wake word detection stops working, verify the wake word service or plugin is running, the microphone is detected, and input levels are not muted or too low.
For HiveMind satellites, ensure they can reach the main brain host on the correct port and that any firewalls are not blocking traffic.
When debugging OVOS, inspect logs for ovos-core, ovos-audio, and the messagebus. They often reveal missing configuration files, invalid skills, or network errors.
